original: A list of top frequently asked  JUnit interview questions  and answers are given below.
result: Below is a compilation of popular JUnit interview questions and answers that can be asked during job interviews in relation to JUnit.

original: Testing is the process of checking the functionality of the application whether it fulfills the requirement or not.
result: The act of testing involves inspecting the performance of an application with the aim of verifying whether it meets the specified requirements or not.

original: JUnit is the testing framework, it is used for unit testing of Java code.
result: JUnit is a framework that facilitates the process of unit testing in Java programming. It offers a set of features that simplifies the testing process and helps developers identify any errors or failures in their code.

original: The process of testing individual functionality (known as a unit) of the application is called unit testing.
result: Unit testing is a technique that involves testing individual units of application functionality. It checks whether each unit functions as expected and identifies any errors or defects. This process helps ensure the overall quality and reliability of the application.

original: Manual testing is performed by Human, so it is time-consuming and costly. Automated testing is performed by testing tools or programs, so it is fast and less costly.
result: Manual testing requires human input and is therefore a process that demands a lot of time and money. On the other hand, automated testing utilizes programs or tools for testing, making it quicker and more cost-effective.

original: Following are some disadvantages of manual testing:
result: Here are some drawbacks of using manual testing methods:

original: The testing is very time consuming and is very tiring.
result: Conducting tests can be a lengthy and exhausting process.

original: The testing demands a very big investment in the human resources.
result: Conducting tests requires a substantial allocation of staff and personnel resources.

original: The testing is less reliable
result: The accuracy of the tests is lower.

original: The testing cannot be programmed.
result: It is not possible to automate or pre-program the testing process.

original: Some of the advantages of automated testing are:
result: Automated testing has several benefits.

original: It is very fast.
result: The speed of this thing is quite impressive.

original: Investment is very less.
result: The amount of money invested is minimal.

original: Testing is more reliable.
result: Testing provides greater dependability.

original: The testing can be programmed.
result: It is possible to automate the testing process by creating a set of programmed instructions.

original: No, we should write the test case only for that logic that can be reasonably broken.
result: We should develop test cases only for the logic or functionality that has the potential to be reasonably disrupted or compromised.

original: Annotation support for test cases
result: Addition of notes to test cases for better documentation and tracking purposes.

original: Assertion support for checking the expected result
result: Provide support for an assertion to verify the anticipated outcome.

original: Test runner support to execute the test case
result: Provide support for test runners that enable the execution of test cases.

original: To test the protected method, the test class is declared in the same package as the target class.
result: In order to evaluate a protected method, the test class must belong to the same package as the class being tested.

original: There is no direct way for testing of the private method; hence manual testing is to be performed, or the method is changed to "protected" method.
result: It is not possible to perform direct testing of a private method. In such cases, manual testing is the only way or alternatively, the method could be modified to a "protected" method.

original: JUnit test methods are designed to return 'void'. So the execution will fail.
result: It is not possible to have a JUnit test method that returns a value other than 'void'. This means that if a test method returns anything, the execution of the code will fail.

original: Junit extension class, XMLTestCase and set of supporting classes is provided by the XMLUnit.
result: XMLUnit provides a JUnit extension class, as well as an XMLTestCase and several related classes, for testing XML documents.

original: A Unit Test Case is the combination of input data and expected output result. It is defined to test the functionality of a unit.
result: A Unit Test Case is a critical tool utilized to ensure the proper and expected behavior of a unit. It consists of input data and anticipated output results, and serves to test the functionality of the unit under examination.

original: The @Test annotation is used to mark the method as the test method.
result: The @Test annotation is a way to indicate that a specific method is being used as a test method. It serves as a marker that the method is intended to carry out testing.

original: The test suit allows us to group multiple test cases so that it can be run together. TestSuit is the container class under junit.framework.TestSuite package.
result: The TestSuite class in the junit.framework.TestSuite package is used as a container for grouping together multiple test cases to be run simultaneously.

original: The test runner is used to execute the test cases.
result: The tool responsible for running the test cases is known as a test runner.

original: The test runner is used to execute the test cases.
result: The purpose of the test runner is to run and carry out the test cases.

original: Assert class provides methods to test the test cases.
result: The Assert class offers a set of functions that can be used to verify the results of test cases.
